body_html:
After banging my head around a couple of days, installing cuda 9.2 but failing tf builds from scratch uninstalling then downgrading to 9.0 to use pre compiled binaries :

Dirty hack till tf updates cuda support

GCC : (Ubuntu 7.3.0-16ubuntu3) 7.3.0
OS :
linux -4.15.0-20-generic
x86_64
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=18.04
GPU :
00:07.0 3D controller: NVIDIA Corporation GV100 [Tesla V100 SXM2] (rev a1)

CUDA :
Driver version : 396.26
Toolkit : 9.2 and 9.0 both installed by sudo sh cuda_9.*****-run (download from nvidia ) but for installing 9.0 say N when asks to install display driver.

then do as said above : #issuecomment-365089833

LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64 >> ~/.bashrc

body:
After banging my head around a couple of days, installing cuda 9.2 but failing tf builds from scratch  uninstalling then downgrading to 9.0 to use pre compiled binaries : 

Dirty hack till tf updates cuda support 

**GCC :** (Ubuntu 7.3.0-16ubuntu3) 7.3.0
**OS :** 
linux -4.15.0-20-generic
x86_64
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=18.04
**GPU :**  
00:07.0 3D controller: NVIDIA Corporation GV100 [Tesla V100 SXM2] (rev a1)

**CUDA :**  
Driver version : 396.26 
Toolkit : 9.2 and 9.0 both installed by sudo sh cuda_9.*****-run  (download from nvidia ) but for installing 9.0 say N when asks to install display driver.


then do as said above : #issuecomment-365089833 

 LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64 >> ~/.bashrc
